channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024120209
item.description:
Report E-2024120209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncturing the pail. The material was Ultra 7000 U7209. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120159
item.description:
Report E-2024120159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 50-gallon paper bag due to the bag being ripped against a piece of metal in the trailer. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum and placed the remaining product into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120157
item.description:
Report E-2024120157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-16
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from one (1) 20-gallon poly drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum being cracked. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The overpack was placed into one (1) 30-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120064
item.description:
Report E-2024120064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: NEW CARLISLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 4, 2024, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of paint thinner were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted waste and the damaged pails were containerized in five (5) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120055
item.description:
Report E-2024120055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured by a nail when a skid was broken at the terminal. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized it and the PM solvent into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. Addition PM solvent was containerized in one (1) 65-gallon medal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110458
item.description:
Report E-2024110458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drum was delivered to the 10-day transfer station. Upon inspection of the container, it was noted that the drum was leaking approximately 1 ounce of liquid from the lid closure and down the side of the drum. The lid was completely closed and torqued. The transfer station suspected the gasket may have been compromised or missing. Container was wiped clean and overpacked.
